Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HistoryTraveler26
Reviews.Content: If you want to be close to the Louvre and other sites in central Paris, this is a good bet. The hotel staff was uniformly friendly and helpful and all spoke English well. I didn't have breakfast at the hotel, because half a block away is a great bakery that supplied wonderful goodies for breakfast daily. My room was typically small for Europe; the bathroom was as well. The bed had an uncomfortable matress that sloped towards the edge--not enough that I fell out, but enough to make me wonder. I traveled as a single but booked a double room. It would have been quite cramped for two people. I noticed on the room plan posted on the door that there was one room smaller than mine on the second floor, but the others were larger. My room faced onto a kind of large air shaft, which meant the room was quiet. However, one night both party noises and cooking smells from one of the adjacent apartments was bothersome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lilmishabear
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on many good reviews and the location. This is another good review. We were given room 16 which is right next to the spiral staircase. It had two solid doors and we heard nothing all night. Plus, it was not on the road so no noise there either. The room itself was typical small by US standards, but the bathroom was nice and large. TV worked and WIFI worked as well. Didn't try breakfast so can't comment on that. People at the front desk were all nice and helpful. About 20 minutes walk to Champs Elysee and 3 minutes to Louvre. A great choice if you want a good hotel in the heart of the city.

Reviews.Title: “location, service, price - excellent”
Reviews.Author: Teresa W
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights in the cold snap during Feb when it snowed in Paris - It was a delight to walk back into the hotel, which was always lovely and warm. The room was beautifully heated, the view from the balcony window, although opening onto the street, still had a view of the Tuilleries. Our room was in fact very spacious. The bed was massive, and everything lovely and clean. ( I suggest this fifth floor room) Handy to have the elevator - there are still hotels in Paris without them. The staff were all very helpful and friendly, and made us feel comfortable - organised tour bookings, taxi's etc as we cannot speak French. We felt welcome here, and would definately stay here again. The location is outstanding - minutes walk to the Louvre, metro, restaurants, and of course tuilleries.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: RockyTop
Reviews.Content: As many reviewers have already stated, the room is small, but comfortable, clean, and most importantly it has location, location, location as you can see by the photo taken from our balcony (room #66) looking toward the Tuillieries. Everything is within walking distance and you can catch the bato-boats if you’d rather not walk. The Roissy bus stop at the Opera is about a 10 minute walk away (10 euro’s/person) and there were four buses at the Opera at 8:30 am when we were leaving for the airport so we didn’t have a wait (they run every 15 or so minutes). This was a Friday to Tuesday trip for us so it was important that it was easy to get to the hotel and walk everywhere we wanted to go and get back to CDG. The hotel elevator is small like everyone has described it, 2 people or 1 person and a bag or two (180 KG limit). We didn’t find it to be a problem even though we wanted to be on the top floor (6th). We didn’t turn on the heat in the room, but it got warm so we opened the doors to cool it down and there wasn’t a lot of street noise. The walls are thin and we did have a neighbor that watched TV until the wee hours of the morning (flat screen TV’s are mounted on the wall). The only thing I would do differently if we returned would be to not prepay for the breakfast. It was okay, but I don’t think it was worth 14 euro’s/person. We found a great patisserie a block up (left on Rue St. Honore) so that would have been an option for breakfast goodies too since we found the sandwiches were good there. There is also a small market across the street from it where we bought fruit, yogurt and other stuff to snack on. The prices were reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Ro8erts
Reviews.Content: Stayed four five nights in December. Can't comment about food as we were room only, but the room was great and the staff extremely friendly and helpful. The two-person lift is an interesting feature! As for location, to visit all the major tourist attractions in Paris I cannot imagine many places better located, and certainly not at this budget. Paris is not my favourite city, but if I go back, I'll be staying in the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend city break in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Paul D
Reviews.Content: Originally tried to book this hotel through Eurostar but their website was incompetent so I chose to book direct on the hotel's own website which worked very well. Choice was based on location- excellent for central Paris, close to Louvre, Tuilleries etc. A warm welcome greeted us with staff who were both helpful and knowledgeable. The room was well maintained, clean and large by hotel standards 25 sq. m. with a full internal bathroom (no extractor). It was warm with adjustable heating. Beds were very comfortable. There is a two person lift to all floors. There was a 24 hour receptionist who was always very helpful. Breakfast was adequate and could be taken either in the restauraunt/lobby area or as room service in one's room. Overall an excellent choice and we would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday week in Paris”
Reviews.Author: cycle-dad50ish
Reviews.Content: I echo earlier reviews: wonderful, helpful staff, fantastic location, clean, comfortable rooms. Not fancy, but as one guidebook said, an oasis of value in a sea of opulence, right in between R. St. Honoré and the Tuileries. Well done M. Veysierre et les autrès. On va retourner. P.S. One suggestion: upgrade Wi-fi, so one does not have to login each time it is used.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Location”
Reviews.Author: Nicki F
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Paris and I spent hours researching and reading reviews on where to stay. We were delighted with our choice. Close to everything so we could walk,staff were helpful. Room clean and quiet

Reviews.Title: “Location,Staff and Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ben A
Reviews.Content: Many times in Paris but first time in this lovely hotel. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find!”
Reviews.Author: cubsfan0121
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel. The staff, rooms, and location could not have been better. We arrived in the early morning and were allowed to check in early. The front desk staff spoke wonderful English and even helped us print our reservations for the Eiffel Tower and helped us check into our flight home. The hotel is very easy to get to from CDG using the RER B and quick transfer to the metro. The Louvre is right across the street and if you continue across the river you will be at the Musse de orsay and access to the RER C line to get to Versailles. We had a triple room (room 40) and it was huge! Very modern and clean. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with lovely staff and brilliant location!”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraBrian
Reviews.Content: This was our sixth visit to the Louvre Montana and I cannot recommend it enough! We have stayed in various rooms but do prefer the ones overlooking the Rue Saint Roch, as they have french windows opening onto the street. We stayed in Room 20 (Deluxe Room) this time and it was lovely. Very large room, especially for Paris, with an enormous bed and large bathroom, clean and very comfortable. The breakfast is ample and fresh. Nothing is to much trouble for the staff who are extremely helpful and arranged a taxi for us when parisshuttle.com did not arrive to pick us up to take us back to the airport (thanks Michael). The Louvre is on your doorstep and we find we can walk to most major attractions. All I can say is that we love this hotel and would definitely recommend it and with be back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Relaxtion”
Reviews.Author: jonspurlock
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone. Great location.. Wonderful, helpful staff. Room is apprpropriate for Paris .. Most all Parisian rooms are of intimate size. Room #26, a single/ double... with a wonderful bathroom! ( big for Paris! ), If it were not for the toilette, you could actually fit a single bed in this room. I made arrangements in this Hotel after seeing the location to the Mtetro and various sites to be visited. So....also, fantastic location. Close to just about anything you will want to see ( by foot, of Metro ) .. Get a 3-5 day ,Metro pass to maximize your ability to get around Pari without having to rely on general Taxi trasport. (which also works, just cost much more nad you do not get a traveling Paris experienc ) Safe Traveling, Jon

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: thetraveller101_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and found the staff extremely friendly and extremely helpful - nothing was too much trouble. The room (family room, Room 30) was extremely spacious, clean and very comfortable. It was noisy when you opened the windows - but not at all unexpected in the heart of Paris. The bathroom was extremely large, exceptionally clean, fresh towels each day plus accessories and certainly no cockroaches!!!. There were tea and coffee making facilities, plus a safe - ideal for storing away items you didn't wish to carry around, free Wi-Fi. We chose not to have breakfast as there were plenty of places nearby to eat, but it looked to be very good from what we could tell. It is ideally located for the Louvre and only a few minute walk from the nearest ParisOpentour bus stop. We would most definitely recommend it and would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel (@room 20)!”
Reviews.Author: SaarB
Reviews.Content: Hi, Unlike reviews below room 20 was huge and bathroom is big as well. Now, the location is superb, breakfast at Angelina [http://www.angelina-paris.fr/en/] is only 20Euro and the atmosphere is a must (also tasty). Overall, clean, great hotel with free Wi-Fi as well. Recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Location,location...”
Reviews.Author: FCINUSA
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. We were two adults and two kids in a quad. The room was spotless and looked freshly painted with new carpet. We requested early checkin and they were able to accommodate us. The room was always made up nicely. We had wireless Internet that worked fine. The staff was very helpful. You cannot beat the location of this hotel. You are close to everything. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rachel A
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for 3 days during our recent trip to Paris. We were a little bit put off at first, because they were repainting the lobby as we checked in, and the whole place smelled very strongly of paint. However, after we complained, they brought up some air freshener and the smell eventually faded. Our rooms were on the top floor and looked into a courtyard at the back of the hotel, which was nice, since there was construction going on in front. We asked about switching rooms, since our rooms were on the top floor and thus had very low ceilings, but they didn't have 2 adjacent rooms available on any of the lower floors, so we chose to stick with our small, low-ceilinged rooms. The beds were sufficiently comfortable and the bathrooms were large. Breakfast was OK, and everyone on the staff was perfectly friendly. We didn't spend much time in the hotel because we were out exploring the city, and this was a great place to stay in Paris, since it was right across from the Tuileries and the Louvre, blocks away from the Champs Elysee. It's on the 1 metro line, so everywhere in the city is easily accessible within minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: DMC21046
Reviews.Content: My family had a wonderful experience at this hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean and recently updated. The location was absolutely perfect with easy access to the metro and shops. Breakfast was a bit expensive but there are plenty of little cafes right around the corner that serve typical French breakfast fare. We would absolutely go back during our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Such a quaint little hotel! Great location for the Louv're.”
Reviews.Author: daisy4me
Reviews.Content: For the people who complained about how small and old this hotel is, go with an open mind. What a jewel of a place. Yes it is old, but they have remodled , nice new bathrooms, clean rooms. The lift is small, so what. That is what makes this hotel unique. Yes its true that one person at a time and their luggage, but what wonderful memories we have. The staff was so friendly and helped us in directions, taxi and etc.. Louv're was maybe 10 minute easy walk. We walked all the way to Arch de Triumph. It took maybe 30 - 40 minutes at easy stroll. Alot of resturants near this hotel also. Subway was close also. This hotel has alot of character. Yes we would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location, newly renovated”
Reviews.Author: Girl_from_Gumble
Reviews.Content: Friendly, helpful staff. Convenient location to transport, attractions (Louvre, bus tours), restaurants, mini-mart, patisserie, shopping. Tuilleries carnival at end of street was a bonus for our 3 year old. Renovations in progress in public areas - our room had been recently refurbished. Room small, but plenty of Parisienne charm.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very clean!”
Reviews.Author: MarylandMegs
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the Emeraude Louvre Montana Hotel. The location is excellent- close to the Louvre and the metro and Rue de Rivoli. The hotel was in the process of being renovated and they were painting the lobby but the painters did their best to remain in the background and were very quiet. Both of our rooms had already been renovated with new beds, furniture, wallpaper,carpet, etc.. The rooms were oversized by Europe standards. The beds and linens were new and quite comfortable. The bathroom was large with marble tile floor and shower/tub and very clean and tidy. The room also had blackout curtains which was great. We stayed on the 5th floor and noise from the street was minimal. There was a balcony in both rooms. Breakfast was included with our room and was basic but adequate. It included hard boiled eggs, cereals, croissants, yogurt, and a small selection of cold meat and cheese. Tea and coffee were also available. The hotel staff was very accomodating and helpful. A computer is available for use in the lobby free of charge. There was a mini bar in the room as well as a coffee/tea maker. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location; very nice overall. Would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Sara013
Reviews.Content: A few blocks from the Louvre and walkable to many other attractions. Staff professional. Rooms decent size for Paris and were clean and newly renovated. (Entire hotel was undergoing renovation when we were there.) Had nice breakfast area (kind of expensive); we did not eat there. We walked down the street to a local restaurant. Wi-Fi really only worked well in the lobby - we were on the 6th (top) floor. Small 2-person lift was not working when we arrived, which made us very concerned. Walking 6 flights up was really not a reasonable option. However, it was back in operation within 20 minutes so crisis avoided! (Recommend that anyone with health/mobility issues may want to stay on 1st or 2nd floor to counter any potential lift problems).

Reviews.Title: “A lovely Hotel, excellent staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: NosheenN
Reviews.Content: I went with my parents on the 8th of June to the 10th of June, 2011 for two nights. Though the hotel was under renovation, it did not bother us too much. its a well situated Hotel, right in the heart of Paris. The staff was excellent.....thank u Arri!! The Louvre is a stones through away and we managed to spend a lot of time there. We took the hop on hop off bus which is close to the hotel. The breakfast was nice . I will definately love to go back to paris and if i will definately stay in the Hotel for its excellent staff and facilities...and also its amazing location.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: nonny1414
Reviews.Content: My daughter, granddaughter and I just returned from Paris, 4 nights at the Hotel Emeraude Louvre Montana. We stayed across the street (Rue St. Roch near Rue de Rivoli) at the Hotel St. Romaine, currently under construction. The location is amazing and the Rue St. Roch has become more fashionable since our last visit. It is a 5 minute walk to the Louvre and less than that to the Rivoli subway stop, from which you can go anywhere in Paris with ease. The hotel is small (25 rooms), old and comfortable. It has A/C, which is a huge plus. The lift is ancient and charming, the front desk manned at all hours with friendly, English speaking staff, the room was adequate, the beds very comfortable, but the carpet was dirty and needs to be replaced. Bathrooms are remodled in marble and large. The breakfast is too expensive by far at $13 euros per person. It is strictly a cold meal with the exception of an egg poacher and a toaster. There are fair croissants, yoghurts, hard rolls and cold cereal, plus prunes. There is no fresh fruit. This is a big drawback. Not even a banana, and in June there is fresh fruit at stands all over Paris. The hotel also offers extremely expensive room service meals, including caviar at $119 euros, but there is no kitchen evident at the hotel, so room service must be catered. Cafe au lait is great! The hotel needs redecoration but the location and good service make the faults less consequential.

Reviews.Title: “Find somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Teampower
Reviews.Content: We were really disappointed with this hotel. Of all the places we've stayed on our honeymoon so far (many throughout Italy & Nice) we've always had pleasant experiences. As one of the more expensive hotels in our stay we expected much more! Our room was on the 5th floor and all around there was construction going on in the hotel with drilling tradespeople etc. But beyond this our room was tiny and on a slope! The furniture & bed were all sloping down and we asked about it but were told that is how Paris buildings are?! They offered free wifi but it hardly worked and could only be accessed from the foyer even though we were told it would work in our room. The breakfast which was included in our stay was less than average & we ended up not eating. Good location but would try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot beat the location”
Reviews.Author: FranklinPack
Reviews.Content: The Louvre Montana is a cozy hotel in a perfection location. The staff are exceptionally friendly and very helpful to visitors. The hotel is in an older building so the walls are thin and floors can be noisy but rooms have plenty of space, everything is clean and our bathroom was recently remodeled. Centennial breakfast is so-so but that isn’t why we traveled to Paris and I’ve certainly had worse. Would likely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We were so pleased with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: yknutson
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the best location we could have asked for, also including breakfast made it perfect. We had breakfast and then went on our way. Bus stop and metro very close. Lots of shopping and museums. The staff was extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable, convenient, and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: donnaesperon
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was great, close to sightseeing spots, good restaurants and great shopping. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. We would definitely recommend this hotel to friends visiting Paris

Reviews.Title: “Loved the charm of the Louvre Montana”
Reviews.Author: lynnrowley
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the hotel. The location couldn't be better and the staff was kind and friendly (especially Ari who cheerfully helped us again and again). The room was roomy and clean and the the pillows and linens were wonderful. We'd love to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff, and location”
Reviews.Author: danveeeeeeeeee
Reviews.Content: I think there is enough praise for this hotel to warrant me not repeating it, so, in short, it's a great hotel (not too old, not too modern) in a great location with super-friendly, bilingual staff! The ONLY complaint I have is with their breakfast. It's not made clear whether the breakfast is included, and so 4 days into we finally realized that we were paying 14 Euro EACH for coffee and cereal. I would suggest not getting breakfast, or packing some extra food up for lunch (which would balance out the 14 Euro). My suggestion to the Hotel Emeraude was to incorporate a breakfast-for-linens "exchange" program: If you choose to not have the chambermaids change your sheets and/or towels, you receive a free breakfast (or at least half off) coupon. Another hotel incorporated this in order to get people to be more conscious of the environment, and I thought it was a neat idea! If enough of us travelers suggest this, maybe the Hotel Emeraude will do it, too.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to our return!”
Reviews.Author: ggoodspeed
Reviews.Content: Location is everything and the value of this location is nothing short of outstanding. Within short walking distance of many top sights as well as outstanding places to dine. The staff is friendly and helpful. While the rooms are small, they are adequate, and the pillows afford a very good night's sleep after a long journey or busy day. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelingSailer
Reviews.Content: Great Location! Nice, Clean, Friendly hotel in the heart of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Been twice in two years”
Reviews.Author: ForTheLoveOfMyWife
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, friendly staff, awesome location. Prior comment about lack of English channels. A second button needed to be pushed on the remote for CNN BBC etc. Wifi was a bit intermittent. Breakfast was complete

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: gmacdos
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in city center. Within walking distance of many major attractions. Louvre is across the street. Wonderful restaurants close and a nice market around the corner for daily needs. I only had 1 issue, there were no english tv channels. Most european hotels i stay in usually have atleast BBC. But you cannot beat this location. Best to ask front desk for nearest taxi station. Paris is the toughest city I have visited for getting a taxi for the one site we visited away from city center. Bed was very comfortable. I loved the antique elevator. It was faster than most modern elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: birdmyster
Reviews.Content: Great for a 3 star hotel. The location was ideal, 2mins walk to the metro (yellow line), cafes and shopping near by. Staff were extremely helpful, even the cleaners had a smile on their faces. The room size is decent (standard room), the bathroom was huge (more than half the size of the actually room). We find the wall to be thin (we could hear other guest going in and out of their rooms). Didnt try the breakfast as 12euro was a little too much, plenty of cafes within waking distance. Wifi in the hotel was quick!! The odd thing about the hotel is that we have to leave our room key everytime we go out (this is for room cleaning purposes). The lift was a unique experience too, barely fitting 2 people with luggages but i guess all lifts in paris hotels are like that (i've heard worst). Another important mentioned is the security where they actually lock the main doors after midnight which is good. All in all, we had a plesent time staying at the louvre montana. Would definetely stay in this hotel again the next time in paris!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: MarkJeanandkids
Reviews.Content: I've travelled a LOT in Europe, and this hotel was really the first that exceeded my expectations. The staff were absolutely wonderful - very friendly, very helpful (and they had no problem with English whatsoever - desk staff, chambermaids, etc). We stayed in a "Quad" room (4 single beds) and the beds were very comfortable (I loved the soft sheets!). Bathroom was very clean, and the Wifi connection was excellent in the room as well as the lobby. The continental breakfast was more than adequate - and our kids can be a bit picky! The location was truly marvelous: 1/2 block to Rue De Rivoli, then only a block or two to the Louvre in one direction or the Tuileries metro stop in the other. For the typical tourist traveller, you simply cannot get a better location! Bottom line: if we were going back to Paris (and we had such a wonderful time that we plan on it), we would not even consider staying anywhere else! These folks really do a superb job!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: starbord_traveller
Reviews.Content: If you only have a few days in Paris The Emeraude Hotel would be a great choice. It is within walking distance of many of the main tourist sites and has a Metro Station (Palais Royal) within a short walk. The rooms are small which is typical in Paris as are the lifts. You may need to make 2 trips with bags. The staff are very helpful. Try Angelina's around the corner, opposite Tuileries Gardens- just don't order a cappuccino. So get a map and start walking. You'll love Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for price, big clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: WanderingSpriti
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on TripAdvisor's forum reviews and we were very happy. The location of this hotel is fantastic - walking distance from Louvre, Jardine De Tulliers, Opera, Musee De Orsay. CITYRAMA office is one block away, metro station is very close and quick eats abound - including some international cuisine. We walked to Notre Dame and Eifell tower too but the tower was a longer walk. Rooms were big and so was bathroom. Clean too. Elevator is small but we did not mind. Hotel is inside a lane, so, not noisy, which was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Small, friendly and well located”
Reviews.Author: rhutchinson
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for one night only but would not hesitate to go back. The reception staff were friendly and helpful. The room was at the back of the hotel and there was no view out the window but that was the only fault. It was clean, well-equipped and nicely decorated. The bathroom was enormous and the shower was a perfect temperature and strength. I could have stayed in there all day!! The location is perfect for all the major sites and within a short distance of 2 metro stations. the cleaning staff were really cheery and made me feel very welcome. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “They have a great photographer!!!!”
Reviews.Author: romerso
Reviews.Content: The staff could not have been more helpful and the location is across from the Louvre and Orsay Museums. It is near the metro(subway), a few shops and resturants are nearby. The hotel is in desperate need of bed pillows...... The hotel is spotless but one could be disappointed in their room vs. the photos provided by the hotel. Our room was off the street so it was safe and quite except for the squeaky floors and doors slaming in the early a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Location is perfect!”
Reviews.Author: travelmore24
Reviews.Content: Like many other reviews, the best thing about this hotel is the location - it is ideal, walking distance to many of the sites. The hotel staff was helpful, there is an elevator and computer that guests can use, and the breakfast was adequate. Our room was on the 5th floor, good size as was the bathroom, with nice balconies. The quiet room was maybe a little worn and the pillows need replacing. Not much available in the way of English speaking TV channels, not that we watched much TV, but it would have been nice to have an alternative to world news. There was a daily charge for a lock to use the safe. All in all, we would recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need within steps”
Reviews.Author: Litlsecret
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location. 1/2 block from the Tulleries Metro which you can take to and from the airport. Walking to the Louvre, D'Orssay, Notre Dame, anyplace you want. The hotel is clean, the rooms are tidy. The breakfast had everything I could want, right down to the fresh pastries. Around the corner of the hotel is an excellent pastisserie and chocolate shoppe. The area is very safe and I had no worries walking around alone at night. I am recommending this hotel to all my friends and will stay here again due to it's value and convenience. The free internet was the best.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, best value”
Reviews.Author: vbmegs
Reviews.Content: We visited Paris in March 2009 - not 2010 but the review didn't allow me to date back that far. We found our trip through EuropeanDestinations.com where you can choose your own hotels in each city, depending on how much you want to spend. The Louvre Montana seemed like such a great value, I was scared that we would be disappointed. When we arrived, I could not believe what an excellent location we had! The hotel is directly off of Rue de Rivoli, steps from the Louvre and Tuileries Gardens. Easy access to the Metro and the train which will take you to Versailles and other places outside the city. We were also very close to Musee d'Orsay, my favorite part of the trip - better than the Louvre. There are lots of crowds in the Louvre and it seems so big and overwhelming. Musee d"Orsay is smaller, an old train station and houses many works from the Impressionist period. We were able to get up close to works from van Gogh, Degas and Monet, something you can't do with the Mona Lisa in the Louvre. We spent an entire day at Versailles which was worth it, easy trip, but we froze in the line as it's not yet warm in Paris in March. Please visit Angelina's, a few blocks down Rue de Rivoli from the hotel, has the world's best hot chocolate and incredible desserts. We bought some to take home to our families. Better souvenirs than anything else we could find in Paris. Overall excellent trip, the hotel is clean, safe and has breakfast every day - that saved us money and time. I was petrified of the lift, too small for my claustrophobic taste, so my boyfriend rode up every evening while I worked off my Nutella filled crepes with a quick climb up the steps. We could see Sacre Coeur from our hotel window, very cool. Excellent shops and cafes around the hotel, great deals for food especially with the poor exchange rate at the time, I would prefer an authentic experience in Paris rather than going to a big restaurant and paying for overpriced food - I can do that here in Richmond.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Best location”
Reviews.Author: AucklandRock
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay and it was great to not have to register as all the details are on file. The location is simply great as you can walk to all the attractions. By European standards the rooms are a very good size and very comfortable. breakfast is good and the staff very helpful.The Hotel and staff are great.

Reviews.Title: “Steps from the Louvre, clean, quiet.”
Reviews.Author: Redshino
Reviews.Content: This was a perfectly fine hotel. I had a single room on the top floor and it was quiet and spotlessly clean. Breakfast was plentiful, coffee was fine, but I didn't find out until I had been there a couple of days that it was not included in my tariff, so I advise getting that settled up front as it is rather expensive if it is not included. The staff was friendly, but not particularly knowledgeable about the metro. The hotel is on a quiet side street, but the Louvre is around the corner, and two metro stops are within five minutes walking distance, so I was able to get around Paris quite nicely. One caution...If you have a lot of luggage, be prepared to make several trips to bring it up to your room. The lift is tiny. I'm a typical American, a bit larger than I should be, and I just managed to get myself and one carry on size suitcase into the lift. If you're really big, this may not be the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning Location- a real great find”
Reviews.Author: madisonx24
Reviews.Content: An amazing hotel with friendly staff set right in the heart of paris. Close to restaurants, metro stations and all the best attractions. There were three of us so we stayed in a triple room which was massive and had everything we needed; we saw some of the double rooms which looked quite small but for the amount of time you spend in the room they're fine and actually quite big compared to double rooms in other hotels. Overall our stay was brilliant and i would definenatley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!”
Reviews.Author: Melissa_Britt
Reviews.Content: We ended our trip to Europe with a 3 night stay in Paris for the weekend but spent little time in the hotel room as Paris has so much to offer. This cozy hotel is perfectly located right across the street from the Louvre Museum and on the same street as several souvenir stores. (Tip: buy your little Eiffel tower key chains from these stores and NOT the street merchants that rudely bombard you as you exit the Eiffel tower!) The room was clean and the mini bar was well stocked....we took advantage of the mini bar in our room for the convenience of fresh, cold Evian water and Heinkien even though it did cost too much! I think it was a great value for the location and conveniences, however, the rooms are VERY small European size and the bathroom and shower was even smaller...not to mention the bed was very hard and uncomfortable compared to the rooms we had in Italy. Also, the staff spoke perfect English and were the nicest people we encountered while in Paris! The continental breakfast available at the hotel was decent considering it was a cold menu only (cereal with milk, yogurt, cold meats and cheeses, hard boiled eggs, croissants, and of course cafe au lait) We also had a WONDERFUL view of Sacre Couer (Sacred Heart) Church from our hotel room balcony and I took some great pics of it being that time did not permit us to visit the Montmarte area of Paris. Overall, I do recommend this hotel for the location and helpful staff but if you are looking for four star luxury - this is not the best choice. WARNING: This hotel features a VERY small elevator (which is cute) but not functional for getting multiple people with excess luggage up to the rooms. We just did both fit in the elevator with our large suitcases!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room with a wonderful view!”
Reviews.Author: SuzyDay
Reviews.Content: Had a great room on the top floor, no air conditioning (didn't work), but the opened and the air cooled at night. There were street sounds early in the morning, but we wanted to rise early anyway! We were near everything and walked almost everywhere. The metro was close by and the open tour bus was an easy walk away as was the river boat. We had a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Haley013
Reviews.Content: Good experience, friendly helpful, staff. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, great location, good value. Excellent Staff!”
Reviews.Author: KXB_08
Reviews.Content: Room was a good size. Great location, 2 blocks from the Louvre. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Bed wasn't the most comfortable, but not the worst either. Did not eat the breakfast, was a little expensive (14 Euros). Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Second time's a charm”
Reviews.Author: roanokecpaguy
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to the Hotel Louvre Montana and I am looking forward to a third. This little hotel is in a great location and has a great staff. Helene, Michael and Farid were great at the front desk. Friends were staying at a name hotel on the left bank and said that the Hotel Louvre Montana was nicer than theirs for less the price. If you are looking to stay at someplace elegant and drop a load of money, go down the street to Place Vendome. If you want a nice place to stay that is convenient to the Louvre, the metro, the Opera, the shopping and lots of great restaurants, then the Louvre Montana is a smart option. My daughter was coming to Paris for a college trip --her mother and I decided to tag along. After seeing the 2 star hotel she and her friends were staying in, our daughter decided that staying with mom and dad wasn't so bad after all. One note, wash cloths, bring your own. Didn't realize it but they are considered a personal item and the hotels do not stock them. You can buy them at Galleries Layfayette just up the street. One word of caution -- Bistro Louvre Carrousell on the corner up the street -- stay away -- when it came time to pay the bill the said my credit card was declined -- they tried 3 times to process the charge -- so I paid cash. Later that evening I had an email from the credit card company questioning why I had 3 charges for the same amount from the same restaurant. I went back to the restaurant with the email but suddenly no one spoke English any more. There are better places to eat anyway that are less touristy. Also, there is a great little bakery up the street (go up Rue St Roch and turn left at the end of the block) -- much cheaper and better than the shops along the Rue di Rivoli. From the Hotel Louvre Montana you are right in the heart of Paris and everything is within an easy walking distance or metro ride.

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jack_Danks
Reviews.Content: Very quiet, confortable rooms. Nice bathroom. Perfect location and fair value for price. We did not have the breakfast in the hotel, though. So, I have no comment on that.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly situated in a magnificent area of Paris.”
Reviews.Author: puppydog_10
Reviews.Content: The Louvre Montana is a small, intimate hotel. It is not fancy but provides a comfortable place to sleep, with clean sheets and towels, recently renovated bathrooms and a light breakfast offered with a nice selection of foods. The front desk staff was very helpful and friendlyIt and really went overboard helping guests who were stranded due to the volcanic ash problems. It is not a hotel where you lounge around because of it's size, but it is situated in a wonderful area close to the Tuilleries which are beautiful and many other famous sites. If you want to see all of the current fashions, there are many incredible boutiques very close buy and food of all sort just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “best location”
Reviews.Author: yukoNagoya
Reviews.Content: This hotel stands in a very convenient location. Stuffs are very friendly and kind. The room we stayed was quite spacious. If we have another chance to visit Paris, We would stay this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and service”
Reviews.Author: BigGame23
Reviews.Content: Terrific location. The staff is extremely enthusiastic, friendly and helpful! The location on Rue St Roche is a block from Tuileries Metro stop, and practically across the street from the Louvre. Also, there is a fabulous chocolate shop (Chocolat Michel Cluizel) right around the corner at 201 Rue Saint Honore. I stayed there with my 20 year old son and 18 year old daughter. All in one room with three single beds. The floors creak, the carpet needs to be replaced, and the cleanliness seemed just OK. But the room was large and certainly met all of our needs. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It was great”
Reviews.Author: Gumper1
Reviews.Content: Thank you to the individuals who work the front desk, they went over backwards to help us. Our reservation started at the hotel across the way but due to not seeing the reservation was for 3 people once we got there they could not accommodate us. This hotel had a room available for part of the stay then offered to hold our luggage and try to find other accommodation when we were out so that we could enjoy our quick stay in Paris. They ended up having a cancellation and we stayed the entire time there. Rooms were very comfortable and we were walking distance to everything. Subway was close by as well. So not only great and friendly staff but close to everything and comfortable accommodation…it was great. Did not use breakfast room and no spa, this is mostly for those coming to enjoy the Paris sights.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with very nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: Jericho42
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located about one block from the Louvre. It is also within walking distance of Notre Dame Cathedral and the Musee d'Orsay. There is a Metro (subway) stop very nearby, which will take you to Arch de Triomphe, Sacre Couer, and the Eiffel Tower. Overall, a very pleasant experience. The staff members were very friendly and helpful. I would absolutely recommend this hotel during your stay in Paris. Truly delightful!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: tibey1204
Reviews.Content: This hotel room was very musty and completely outdated. The breakfast room doubles as the dining room and hotel bar. This is more like a 2 star hotel. For the price you should stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient but very small room and poor breakfast”
Reviews.Author: TCSCambridge_UK
Reviews.Content: Hotel in excellent position in quiet street very close to Louvre, Jardin Tuileries but classic rooms on 5th and 6th floors very small, nowhere to unpack luggage and only adequately clean. Superior room would have been fine. Sound proofing also non-existant. However reception desk very helpful and reasonable rate for high season. If you want a decent cup of coffee for breakfast go out to one of the many local cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and good friendly service”
Reviews.Author: dpmf
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Louvre Montana for four days in the second week of July and loved it. The location is amazing as it's within walking distance of the Louvre, the Tuileries, and the Opera House. Compared to the price of some other hotels in the area this one was a fantastic bargain! The room was spacious, and the brand new renovated bathroom was gorgeous. The staff were really friendly, and were happy to help out in english when my french failed. I'd definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, quaint little THREE star hotel (it's on the sign).”
Reviews.Author: KBtheFirst
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the star ratings on the internet. It's really a three star hotel. It does not have a restaurant, it does serve a nice continental breakfast (14 euros per day - kind of pricey). The location is great, the rooms are very large for Paris, it was a nice change to have some room. The decor in the rooms is a little tired, and I really hated the little plastic coffee cups they provide with a tea and coffee service in the room - I mean really. Overall, the price for the location was good, rooms were comfy and the bathrooms were pretty large. We even had a little balcony. I've stayed at another three star hotel over in the Latin Quarter and I'd rather stay over by the Louvre - much closer to everything and cuts down on the hot subway rides. Wonderful chocolate shop a block away. Sweet little place. They charge a lot for the internet (one day or three day pass - the three day was $50 + euro - kind of crazy.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room with attention to details”
Reviews.Author: familytravelertampa
Reviews.Content: We had a good experience at the Hotel Louvre Montana. The location was absolutely excellent! We were just across from the Louvre and Tuilerie Gardens and within 1 block of the Metro. The rooms were nice and quiet with the windows closed - there is good sound-proofing. The staff was friendly and spoke some English. The room was very comfortable with most all amenities, surprising for a 3 star hotel. The lift was interesting - there were 3 of us and it had a 2 person capacity, so one person typically had to walk up to our fourth floor room, or wait for the lift to return. The breakfast was expensive, so we opted for breakfast at locations enroute to our destinations. Our luck the lift was being serviced the day/moment that we needed to check out. The staff was very apologetic, offered to carry our 5 bags for us, and removed the charges for the room bar from our bill. Overall, this was a very good experience and we would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and location”
Reviews.Author: write2yeung
Reviews.Content: Helpful, friendly and speak good English staffs. Walking distance to Musee du Louvre, Musee d'Orsay. Just take 5 mins to nearest Metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: the_mrs1021
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little hotel in a great location in Paris. The staff is very friendly and nice, and they always remembered us and our room number when we can back in the evenings. This hotel has the cutest elevator I've ever seen! It's very small, but my husband and I did fit ourselves and our 3 large suitcases! The hotel is close to a Metro station and we did not have to walk far to find a good restaurant at a reasonable price. I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: nancy61
Reviews.Content: Hotel was in an excellent location. It is near the rue de Ravoli which is full of shops and reasonably priced restaurants. It is also within an easy walking distance to many Paris attractions. It was also close to a metro stop, but we walked everywhere. We were travelling with our three teenagers and they had their own room. Both rooms were small, but adequate and clean. The front desk staff was friendly and mostly helpful. The cleaning staff was also very friendly. The breakfast was included in our price and there was enough food out at all times and it was tasty and fresh. The elevator (lift) was small, but it wasn't a big deal to send the luggage up with one person and the rest of us to walk. The hotel was very small, I think only 4 rooms per floor with 6 floors. It almost had the feel of a bed and breakfast and we felt comfortable and safe at all times. I would highly recommend this hotel to young couples or families with young children or teenagers.

Reviews.Title: “Parisian Gem!”
Reviews.Author: chanel03
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel on Tripadvisor. It was a great find. We stayed 6 nightsand the staff cound not have been nicer. They were friendly and went out of their way to accommodate us. Great location. It is walking distance to many of the must see sights of Paris. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service and Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: lbroderick
Reviews.Content: This was an ideal location. 1 1/2 blocks from the Louvre and withing walking distance of the majority of major site seeing attractions. "Superior Room" (street view 3rd flr) with 2 Twin Beds was 220 Euros. Expensive for quality of room as based on US standards, but not horribly expensive as based on European standards. Room was large as compared to other European hotels. Decor and funishings on the older side, but it was clean. Staff was friendly which is unusual as compared to other hotels stayed at afterwards with a 10 tour thru France. Esp. Beatrice - who was exceptionally helpful and nice. Breakfast was buffet and average in terms of food items and quantity provided. Would stay there again, however, I think an even better location to be more centrally located in the city is 2 blocks away near the Place de Concorde rotary (near the St. Madeline) church.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jopav
Reviews.Content: This was our third time in Paris and by far our favorite hotel. The location is wonderful. The rooms are small but that is standard for European hotels. The price was right and the staff was great. I want to take my adult daughter sometime later this year and this is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Honest-Traveler3
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Elevator is tiny. Send luggage up by itself and walk up to your room. Room is clean, bathrooms are large. Bring an international converter, no built in one in room. TV only got French speaking stations with French subtitles even though there was an option for English. Staff was very friendly and courteous. Most speak a broken English. Hotel is right by the Lourve and Tuillerie Gardens. Across the Gardens is the Museum D'Orsay. 10 minutes walk from there is the Rodin Museum. Around the corner from the hotel on Rue du 29 Juillet street behind the Joan of Arc statue is a Scottish bar. Very friendly. Eat at the Italian restaurant right next door to the bar. Excellent food and service. You can take public transit, but we walked everywhere. Also, take a day trip to Normandy. We did a guided tour ina mini-van and it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaTravelNana
Reviews.Content: This is a small hotel. It is very convenient. Close to Tuileries Gardens and Louvre. Owner and his staff were very nice and helpful. Our room was very large with large bathroom especially by European standards. Our breakfast was included and it was more than adequate. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good in parts ...”
Reviews.Author: Valiant2
Reviews.Content: Warm and friendly welcome from Receptionist who listened politely to my daughter's efforts at French, although it later transpired that she and all her Reception colleagues spoke flawless English! We took two rooms, a double for we adults and a triple with 3 single beds for our children. Our room was quite small and needed a few licks of paint, but with a clean and spacious bathroom. The children's room was larger and, really, much better value than ours. The location is fantastic, close to the Louuvre and surrounded by geat bars and cafes and close to the Metro and the beautiful Jardin des Tuileries. As mentioned the staff were friendly and helpful. The cleaning left a little to be desired: there was a Smartie on the stairs on the first day and it became a running joke as we saw it intact on each subsequent day. I'd certainly stay in this location again, and the Louvre was perfectly adequate for a moderate budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, But..........”
Reviews.Author: Deevega
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Paris, and first stayed at the Le Meridien Montparness for five nights. Despite the reviews, we were very happy with our stay. We then stayed at Emeraude Hotel Louvre Montana, for five nights. The room was spacious and worked well for myself and two sisters. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially Farid and Beatrice. They gave directions to different tourist sites, and were very caring and kind. Everything went smoothly until the night before our departure. My sister went downstairs to have the front desk confirm our shuttle as we could not seem to get through on our room phone, Rashid was at the front desk and called the shuttle company, instead of confirming it, he cancelled it. My sister then had him call back and she spoke with the shuttle company, who told her that Rashid had cancelled, so she told him we did not want to cancel, and he said they would pick us up at 8:30 as scheduled. The next morning we waited for our shuttle, but it did not show up. We started to fear we would miss our flight, and told Farid what had happened. He called the Shuttle company and was told that someone from Louvre Montana had cancelled it. Farid then spent quite a bit of time trying to get us transportation to the airport. At 10:15 a.m. a taxi arrived not giving us much time to make our 11:40 flight. The taxi cost us about 85 euro, 30 more than our shuttle. Farid did give us 11.80 toward the taxi, but we still spent more than planned. I would stay at the Hotel Louvre Montana again, but would do transportation confirmations directly.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: dutchreiziger
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel after reading the reviews on this website. We were looking for an unassuming, quiet and clean hotel in crawling distance of the Louvre and musee d'Orsay. We were not disappointed. The location of the Hotel is great. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel. This is Paris, why have breakfast in a hotel? Negative aspects? Yes. The bed in our room was too small. I am 190cm. So was the bed. Also the hotel is twice as expensive as comparable hotels which are 15 minutes by metro away. But, location counts!

Reviews.Title: “impressive service- unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: moviegal3
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Paris... i booked this hotel based on others reviews on tripadvisor,com -- and can happily say the reviews were dead on. The service was top notch-- everyone spoke perfect English-- they went above and beyond to be helpful and offer suggestions. This was our first trip to Paris so i highly recommend this location (near Louvre) as it is centrally located and easy to navigate from here. However-- words of caution -- no internet service, you must pay 14 euros for 24 hours to access their one computer... or make a different deal... breakfast is not included... but this is okay-- there are ample cafes around... elevator is VERY small... biggest room appears to be 2 twin bed room-- TAKE IT -- very spacious. you can push them together.. Would stay there again... i booked on www.venere.com-- the prices seem to be better there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Not_a_millionaire
Reviews.Content: Hotel is right next to the Louvre and the Tuilleries Metro Station, on a quietish side street - not much traffic noise. It's clean and the staff are very friendly and helpful. We upgraded to a queen sized room, and the extra space was great, but the "normal" rooms looked adequate too. Only 4 rooms to a storey, so it's quiet too. Breakfast was a bit chaotic, but perfectly adequate. Would definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Europe”
Reviews.Author: sunflower619
Reviews.Content: My now husband and I stayed at this hotel for the beginning portion of our honeymoon and had a very nice time. The location was awesome, easy access to the subway system and within walking distance to the Louvre and Tuileries Garden. The hotel was clean and well maintained, although not spacious, but we expected that from a European hotel. The breakfast was simple and the staff was very curtious and helpful, as they needed to direct us to several stores since our luggage was delayed by the airline and we were desperate for vacation necessities. I would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find!”
Reviews.Author: mentorohio
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 night stay. Perfect location. 2 blocks from Tuilleries Metro stop, which is on the #1 line and easy for getting to other transfer points. Easy walk to Louvre and Musee D'orsay. Stayed in Superior room with balcony. On one side saw the Tuilleries, on the other, could see the Sacre Couer lit up at night. Large room with very comfortable "King" bed(2 twins put together). Fridge in room very helpful for keeping cheese and snacks cold. Large bathroom. Only complaint, no comfy chair to sit in. We laughed as after a long day of walking, we only had 2 stiff chairs to sit and enjoy our evening glass of wine--oh well, we weren't sitting that long. We paid 219 Euros. The St. James and Albany around the corner showed standard rooms fro 400 and superior for 450. The Hotel du Louvre was a block or so the other way--also much more expensive. This was not a 4 or 5 star by American standards,(and I have stayed at the Ritz and Four Seasons, etc. in several American cities), but was a solid 3 plus. Nice and clean and wonderful helpful staff. Glad I stayed and would recommend. Don't get the breakfast--go around the corner and get croissant and juice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location- Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Sully656
Reviews.Content: We loved the Louvre Montana! We were there for 6 nights for our honeymoon and we would definitely recommend this hotel. We had read that the rooms were small but I don't think we were prepared for what we found. The room was okay maybe for a short trip but not for the amount of time that we were there. We ended up upgrading to a "Superior" room which had a view and was at least twice the size. We highly recommend booking a Superior room if available. The staff at the Louvre Montana were all very friendly and spoke English fluently. They were very helpful in guiding two young Americans who were there on their first trip to Paris. A big thank you to Sylvan and Beatrice for the recommendations and directions. Overall, the hotel is excellent. Great location in Paris; it is very close to several metro stops, restaurants, attractions (Louvre, Tuileries Gardens, Champs Elysees, etc), and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed by this hotel”
Reviews.Author: totaltraveladdict
Reviews.Content: My family and me were thoroughly impressed by the Louvre Montana. The staff are fluent in English, very friendly and always ready to help. One of the gentlemen in reception even went out of his way to book a taxi for us that was big enough to carry my disabled sister's wheelchair, so a big thank you to him! We booked a twin and a double room and both were very clean and comfortable. The twin room was particularly large and all four of us were able to sit in it of an evening without feeling cramped. The breakfast consists of croissants, yogurt, ham, cereal, eggs, juice, coffee, tea etc. I've noticed that other reviewers have complained that the breakfast was too small, but I found it tasty and satisfying. The location of the hotel is excellent and the area felt safe and quite upmarket. The Louvre is just across the road, the Place Vendome is five minutes away and it took us only 20 minutes to walk to the Notre Dame. My favourite thing, though, was the park opposite the hotel from which you can see the Louvre, Eiffel Tower, Place de la Concord and the Arc de Triomph. The only downside to the hotel is that the bar area is very small but there are many bars and restaurants nearby so this isn't a big problem. All in all our stay at the hotel was very enjoyable and I will definately stay here again if I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming and Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Geebee2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Louvre Montana for two periods during a recent trip to Paris, our first visit for 7 nights and then a further 2 nights a week later. We had booked a superior room, and must admit that all the comments in these reviews about the rooms being large by Parisien standards are spot on. The room was almost as good as the PR photos, and if anything the bed was too big (not often that anyone would complain about that). The bathroom was great, with a nice roomy bath to relax in after a day promenading those wonderful, but deadly, streets of Paris. Everything, including the air-conditioning (necessary during an unseasonally warm spell) worked perfectly, always a relief. The location of the hotel is just wonderful with all the must-see sights within walking distance, not to mention a couple of really great little restaurants, a super convenient and well stocked minimart just around the corner, and shops to suit every budget. The staff at the hotel are just delightful, to the point where when we returned after our week on a canal in Burgundy we were welcomed back so warmly that it really did feel as though we had come home. Highly recommend this hotel and will look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: DamienT98
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May and was very pleased with this hotel. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful, giving us a map and marking everything of any interest on it, along with nearby places to eat. (Being a sat night, all these were closed, strangely enough) The room was small, but enough room for 2 people, no view from the window and the TV was broken but this didn't bother us, we spent so much time around Paris, the room was only there for us to sleep in. Location wise, perfect, only a few minutes walk from the Louvre, and a nice 35 minutes walk to the Eiffel Tower. Some advice, we got this hotel rather cheaply on lastminute .com, much less than their normal tariffs...

Reviews.Title: “Loved I Recommend”
Reviews.Author: DanielaBrasil
Reviews.Content: Lovelly staff, very well located, I certainly recomend

Reviews.Title: “excellent from booking to setling the bill”
Reviews.Author: chris&jane
Reviews.Content: we spent 4 nights here mid February and agree with all recent comments : very friendly and helpful staff ; all arrangements as confirmed - we had room 42 fronting rue st roch and quiet. you could get breakfast cheaper, but the hotel's can set you up for the morning. some good restaurants nearby - we liked 'la sourderie' best for it's good food in lovely surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: Murgatronic
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is brilliantly located in a fairly quiet side street off the Rue de Rivoli, about a 2 minute walk from the Louvre and Tuilleries metro station. We stayed for 2 nights and our room was on the 5th floor. The room was smallish but nicely decorated, very clean, a comfortable bed and with a good sized bathroom.We heard virtually nothing from the other guests. As it is in a side street, there is no view from the windows.The room was well equiped with a colour TV (which didn't work very well - a problem with the aerial which we didn't report so I can't say if the problem would have been sorted out immediately), tea making facilities, iron and ironing board, trouser press, fridge, safe (which didn't work), hairdryer (which didn't seem to work) and free toiletries, coffee, tea etc. The reception staff was friendly and helpful and so were the cleaning and breakfast staff. The combined price of Eurostar travel plus 2 nights accommodation was an excellent £143 each. Fantastic value. So a nice hotel, great location, great price, so why not 5 stars? Well when we arrived we were told that breakfast is at 7.30 to 10.30 in the very dinky breakfast bar off the reception. However, what was not made clear (at least not in english) was that the breakfast was an extra and it cost 12 euros per person per night so as we were leaving we had to stump up another 48 euros. The breakfast was fine incidentally. If we had known we could have eaten at a host of different cafes within easy walking distance and started sightseeing a bit earlier. It was probably my own fault for trying to speak French without really being up to the job! Also the TV and safe not working took the shine off the lovely room for me, although we didn't watch much TV anyway as there is too much to do in Paris. A word of warning - the cute lift is tiny, You can only get 2 people in it and luggage would then be a squeeze. If you are very large you might have trouble getting in it.

Reviews.Title: “A well-cared for Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Liffeylady
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in Jan. at this hotel, a gift from our family.Paris is just about my favourite city and we have been lucky enough to make several visits. The Louvre Montana tied with Hotel Jardin de Neuilly as my favourite (including one 4-star hotel)Our room was small but that to us is unimportant if spotlless and attractive, which this certainly was and lacked no comforts. The tiny lift (we called it the padded cell!) was the quietest Ive experienced and our room was next to it. Breakfast was excellent in an attractive space off Reception which magically doubled as a bar later in the day and the server was attentive and good humoured. Location was excellent, just off Rue de Rivoli (Pl. de la Concorde end) two metro stations and buses nearby and Reception pointed us to several nearby (very near) Restaurants, especially La Cordonnerie, where we had lovely food and service from the owner/chef Claude. Couldn't fault this hotel - best of its grade - attention and care showed everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Find”
Reviews.Author: embroidered
Reviews.Content: Booked through Priceline and got a great rate for the week. You can not beat this location as a base for a sight seeing tour of Paris. It is very central and in hindsight... it is right where you would want to be. About 1 block from the METRO station for the M-1 line. One block off the Seine River, and nightlife was about 2 or 3 blocks away. Many restaurants, cafes, etc within a few blocks. The staff was great and very helpful. The front desk is staffed 24 hours a day. The room we had was somewhat small, but based on the rate we payed it is much better than I anticipated. We had a small (French) balcony. They do have a small elevator built into the center of the staircase to get you and your luggage up to your room.

Reviews.Title: “everything we wanted and more”
Reviews.Author: phanson
Reviews.Content: booked through net but hotel also confirmed and when we got there late they were very welcoming and even upgraded us to a spectacularly large room. having stayed in several mid price hotels in Paris I will definitely be back to this one for it's location and overall service. strangely the female staff were the most friendly. I have nothing but praise for this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Style & Comfort”
Reviews.Author: blklthrjkt
Reviews.Content: This charming and well appointed hotel is only steps from the Louvre and is a great place for a vacation or romatic getaway. The rooms are not very large, but very comfortable and the staff is charming. Nice breakfast and great coffee too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: SCATCH8
Reviews.Content: Myself & 2 girlfriends stayed in a triple room at this hotel, great location, 2 mins from Metro station & Louvre Museum, walkable distance to all major attractions. Staff were friendly & helpful, Good Continental breakfast. Room was clean & spacious (exactly like website photographs) with 3 single beds. Would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Grate location,Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: JCXRAY
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is a block from the Louvre, across from the park. We had a top floor room which could have made it quiter, but the room was small but cleen and the bath new. The lift was fun it holds 180 Kg. Only two people could fit, but it works fine. Beatrice was very helpful at the front desk arranging things. Don't eat breakfast in the hotel, there are food stores around the corner. Breakfast is 12 euro in the hotel and is boiled eggs and some ham and bread.

HotelInfo.Name: Emeraude Louvre Montana Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 12 rue Saint Roch | 01 Arr., 75001 Paris, France
